item.title: reflection with 4 earth revolutions @cloudfactory.com
item.description:
its 19May today… 4yrs ago it was a different story

Being in a role: devops@cloudfactory for last ~4yrs of duration, I was able to learn and work with ruby (on rails), play with some 100s of ec2 servers with ansible, paged often about their health/stats(mostly ios), prometheus them & dash few (in clambering graphs), debug some zombies on production (during holidays weekend :/ ), collaborate with some awesome random open-source advocates(great learning times) and best, learned to realize how business directly maps to my tiny shell scripts or yaml files i indent on my editor Emacs. In gist, everyday of it is inspiring, challenging; the more I do it the more I feel good about it.

With this upbringing, seeking/longing to know more about technology, collaboration and different business needs from highly motivated, open mentors & team has been a habit.

4 yrs ago…hehe

And now, I would like to explain my self as guy who love to play with terminals they used to say, old habits die hard, it making more sense now and machines/stacks (damn you containers, you freak me out), compose/deploy ðŸš¢ them (the laziest part of story, mostly), instrument them (favourite one), secure ðŸ›¡ them and tinker with tools to automate it all.

Sounds all flashy ðŸ›¡, but old days of sed-awk burger wars is always missed. Good things I have a #emacs and #tmux gangs to guff on.
